decision_conditions: The Oak has a high amenity value and makes a significant contribution to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the local area and is a significant local landscape feature.

The Oak is situated within the rear garden of 20 Pillions Lane and does not appear to have been pruned (reduced) before. It is approximately 18m in height and stands 15m roughly 15m away from the property. It has an attractive, natural-looking crown typical of the species. The Oak significantly contributes to local biodiversity, and significantly contributes to the visual amenity and arboreal character of the area. The benefit in amenity and biodiversity afforded by the tree is both present and future because it has the potential for a long life expectancy.

The proposed works would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into the tree's crown which could lead to infection; any re-growth that is stimulated would be weakly attached and prone to future failure. Additionally, the proposed work would reduce the
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: To reduce one Oak (T13 on TPO 24) by 25% (1.8m max) to suitable growth points and crown thin by 10%, removing selected finer branches, reduce lateral side growth to match (1.5m) to suitable growth points, lift lower canopy by 1-1.5m w/emphasison LHS.
